net.alternating.alternet
Class Server

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      net.alternating.alternet.Server
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, Deliverer
Direct Known Subclasses:
ObjectServer
public class Server
extends java.lang.Thread
implements Deliverer

This class acts as an asynchronous TCP server. It listens for new connections on the port specified in the constructor and adds the new connections to the list of connections to monitor.

A callback is done every time a new connection is established, a connection is torn down or data is received if the PApplet invoking this server has the correct methods defined.

The appropriate methods in processing are:
void serverConnectEvent(Server serverInstance, RemoteAddress clientAddress);
void serverDisconnectEvent(Server serverInstance, RemoteAddress clientAddress);
void serverReceiveEvent(Server serverInstance, RemoteAddress clientAddress, String data);
void serverReceiveEvent(Server serverInstance, RemoteAddress clientAddress, byte[] data);

The serverReceiveEvent(...) method with the String argument will receive the data as an UTF-8 string. The version with a byte[] will receive the data without any conversions applied to it.

The server itself runs in a separate thread.

Author:
Andreas Löf
See Also:
RemoteAddress, Client

Field Detail

bufferSize

public static int bufferSize
Constructor Detail

Server

public Server(processing.core.PApplet parent,
              int port)
This constructs a new Server. The server will immediately start a new thread and start listening on the specified port on all of the network interfaces present in the computer.

Parameters:
parent - the processing applet that contains the server instance.
port - the port that the server will listen for new connections on
Method Detail

getPort

public int getPort()
Returns the port that this server instance is listening for new connections on

Returns:
the port that the server is bound to

run

public void run()
This method is doing the actual work of the server. It deals with all of the incoming connections and data.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:

throwReceiveEventByteArray

public void throwReceiveEventByteArray(java.nio.ByteBuffer bf)
This is a helper method used to notify the encapsulating processing applet that we have received data. The data will be delivered to the processing applet as a byte[].

Specified by:
throwReceiveEventByteArray in interface Deliverer
Parameters:
bf - the ByteBuffer containing the data
clientChannel - the SocketChannel the data came from

dispose

public void dispose()
This method is called by the processing applet that contains this server instance. All of the open network sockets are closed and the worker thread is told to terminate.

disconnectClient

public void disconnectClient(RemoteAddress clientAddress)
This method is used to disconnect a specific client.

Parameters:
clientAddress - the address of the client to disconnect.
